channel.title: book on C.O.M.
channel.description: Recent content in book on C.O.M.

item.title: The Philosophers’ Library
item.description: According to the blurb, The Philosophers’ Library “… features the most important philosophy manuscripts and books as stepping stones to take you through the history of philosophy.”

item.title: Information and the History of Philosophy
item.description: According to the publisher, “Information and the History of Philosophy is the first comprehensive investigation of the history of philosophical questions around information, including work from before the Common Era to the twenty-first century. It covers scientific and technology-centred notions of information, views of human information processing, as well as socio-political topics such as the control and use of information in societies.”
